website_summaries.verdict: We like the idea of an LCD touch screen, but the one on the Eclipse Wireless Litetouch keyboard has a laundry list of issues.
pros: LCD touch screen with three modes
cons: Inconsistent, sometimes slow LCD touch performance

customer_reviews.title: Cool concept
customer_reviews.text: Keys lit up well, number pad touch pad didn't work all the time. some of the functions were un-useable. Trackball on keyboard for mouse use gets dirty and grimmy quick.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Chau

customer_reviews.title: Room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: Room for improvement. The programmable touchpad prompted this purchase for the convenience and available options for customization. The price through Amazon was much better than retail outlets such as Fry's and Best Buy. The down side to the programmable touch pad is; when the computer goes into standby or hybernation, the keypad goes dark and requires a total "power off" reboot of the computer or the keyboard must be unplugged from the computer and re-plugged to gain access to the touch pad. This may not seem a big inconvenience unless the computer is buried within the desk such as mine. I would like to see a driver re-write to address this issue.
customer_reviews.author: PodGod

customer_reviews.title: Needs improvment
customer_reviews.text: the eclipse wireless keyboard is very cool looking but the trackball isn't great and takes a lot of finesse and getting used to. when making small movements the trackball is difficult to use. as for the wireless aspect of it, it needs a self shutdown, you must always remember to turn the power button off or it will just stay on til the power drains battery life isnt great on this thing either, most of the time i leave mine plugged in which kind of defeats its purpose. its soso ok? but needs improvement but on the other hand it was very cheap too, so how much complaining can i do really?
customer_reviews.author: kraut724

customer_reviews.title: Works off and on, mostly off. Tiny range. Finicky mouse.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about this keyboard because it is beautifully backlit (only pro, seriously) and rechargeable (or so they say), but it's terrible. You have to be right by the computer otherwise the wireless doesn't pick it up, and even when it does it's super finicky and only responds to part of what you do on the keyboard. The mouse is super glitchy - sometimes barely moves and then when you're very close to where you need to click it gets super sensitive and the tiniest movement brings you halfway across the screen. It's actually kind of hilarious how bad this thing is, of course, less so when you paid money for it.
customer_reviews.author: Richelle

customer_reviews.title: Quality too cheap for the Price
customer_reviews.text: After only a few weeks of using this wireless device the trackball on it quit working, the illumination of the keys stopped working. The numerical keypad is not a physical version, but touchscreen & not very good. It takes more than 1 try to make a selection work. Battery life is awfully short & the battery cannot be replaced.

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity issues, LCD issues
customer_reviews.text: It works great until it doesn't. Sometimes I'll have to unplug and plug it in again. The LCD screen will work, but the display will be off. product_meta.title: Eclipse Litetouch Keyboard
product_meta.description:
Style:WiredEclipse Litetouch Keyboard

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


LITETOUCH™ KEYBOARD
 Sharing the majority of features of its wireless variant, the Eclipse litetouch Keyboard has been designed specifically for desktop operation. With its metal finish, top cabinet and quiettouch™ low profile backlit scissor keys; the Eclipse litetouch Keyboard proves an eye catching addition to any office or study setting. 

 With the same touch sensitive LCD 3-in-1 touch panel as found on the wireless litetouch Keyboard, you can access media, surf the internet or perform office tasks at a touch of a button. 





A TOUCH OF AMBIENCE
 Located to the right of the physical scissor keys, the unique litetouch LCD 3-in-1 touch panel provides the user with unprecedented control over their digital life. With a single press, the LCD 3-in-1 touch panel switches between media mode, numerical-pad mode and ‘MyEclipse™’ mode, providing you with a host of commands which can be used to provide dedicated controls for a multitude of activities from replicating a simple office calculator to controlling a complex media center configuration. 

 When the LCD 3-in-1 touch panel is set to MyEclipse mode, you can personalize the touch panel to access their favorite websites and applications. at a touch of a button. Displaying 12 pre-defined icons covering topics such as shopping, finance, health and entertainment, you can assign each icon with your favorite websites, applications, games, and much more. 

 You can even allocate up to a maximum of three individual websites along with an application of your choice to each icon, all of which will open at the same time and all at the touch of just one button, ideal should you access multiple websites and applications when shopping or dealing with your online finance. 

 In addition, the MyEclipse mode provides 5 numbered buttons which you can choose to cover any topic not already included in the pre-defined icons. Setting up MyEclipse is as easy as drag and drop. 




 * litetouch™ LCD touch-sensitive Media Panel.
 * trueview™ backlit keys.
 * Low profile quiettouch™ scissor keys
 * Softtouch™ palm rest
 * Slim profile: A full sized keyboard for a compact space





System Requirements:

Bluetooth-enabled PC or Mac
(Windows 7, Windows XP, XP64, Vista and Mac OS X)
